trans-unit.source: Stores a set of <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> types.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformationCollection"></xref> class.
Throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref> because this operation is not supported for this collection.
The object to be added to the collection.
Throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref> because this operation is not supported for this collection.
Checks whether the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> object to be searched in the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> object exists in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the elements in this collection to a one-dimensional array of type <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref>.
The array parameter must be one-dimensional with zero-based indexing.
A one-dimensional array that receives a copy of the collection.
The zero-based index in array at which the copy begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in this is greater than the available space from offset to the end of the destination array.
The elements in this cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> types in this collection.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that contains the number of <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> types in this collection.
Returns an object that can be used to iterate through this collection.
The object that is returned by this method is initially positioned before the first element in this collection.
You must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method before you can access the first element.
To access the element at the current position, call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property.
Do not modify the collection while using the enumerator.

If the collection is modified while an enumerator is in use, an attempt to set the position by calling <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> causes an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
For a detailed description of enumerators, see the documentation for the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> class and the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> method.

An object that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> interface and provides access to the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> types in this collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether access to this collection is read-only.
`true` in all cases.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> instance at the specified index in the collection.
The zero-based index of the element.
The <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> at the specified location.
Throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref> because the collection is read-only and elements cannot be removed.
The object to be removed.
Always throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.
Returns an object that can be used to iterate through this collection.
The object that is returned by this method is initially positioned before the first element in this collection.
You must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method before you can access the first element.
To access the element at the current position, call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property.
Do not modify the collection while using the enumerator.

If the collection is modified while an enumerator is in use, an attempt to set the position by calling <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> causes an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
For a detailed description of enumerators, see the documentation for the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> class and the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> method.

An object that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> interface and provides access to the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation"></xref> types in this collection.
